title: Russell Wilson ranks Patrick Mahomes amongst other great quarterbacks
description: During a recent media appearance, Russell Wilson ranked Kansas City Chiefs Patrick Mahomes amongst other great quarterbacks
fullText:
The NFL offseason has many players taking time away from the field to address lingering injuries, decisions, and their playing future. The Kansas City Chiefs missed the playoffs in 2025 but are still a topic of conversation off the field, especially starting quarterback Patrick Mahomes.

During a recent episode of 'Hot Ones Versus,' Grammy-winning artist Ciara and Super Bowl champion Russell Wilson faced off with questions and wing challenges. The rules are simple: tell the truth, or suffer the wrath of the 'Last Dab'. Whoever eats the most wings loses, and Wilson answered a tough question regarding four quarterbacks, including himself.

Wilson ranked Mahomes second to Tom Brady, with himself third, ahead of Pro Football Hall of Famer Peyton Manning. The former Seattle Seahawks quarterback defeated Manning's Denver Broncos in Super Bowl XLVIII. He notably chose a spicy wing rather than answering his wife's question about the worst coach he's played for in his career.

The 37-year-old's 2025 season came to an end early with the New York Giants as he was benched after the Chiefs defeated him in Week 3. Wilson lost his starting job to rookie Jaxson Dart and, for the rest of the year, served primarily as a veteran mentor. In three games started (six played), he tossed three touchdowns and three interceptions for 831 yards.

Wilson has been rumored recently to be a potential backup option for the Chiefs in free agency.

This article originally appeared on Chiefs Wire: Russell Wilson ranks Patrick Mahomes amongst other great quarterbacks

title: Was Villa Park chaos advert for VAR?
description: A marginal VAR offside decision caused a fair amount of controversy for Newcastle in midweek.  Joe Willock had a goal disallowed at Tottenham when the semi-automated technology said his forehead was offside.  Abraham's goal was the kind of decision the video review was brought in for - the real howlers.
fullText:
A marginal VAR offside decision caused a fair amount of controversy for Newcastle in midweek. Joe Willock had a goal disallowed at Tottenham when the semi-automated technology said his forehead was offside.

Abraham's goal was the kind of decision the video review was brought in for - the real howlers.

The Villa striker was clearly ahead of the defence when Douglas Luiz played the free-kick. With VAR, the goal would have been ruled out.

It would be easy to blame switching between systems as a defence for the assistant, Nick Greenhalgh. But with or without VAR, he would be expected to raise his flag if he's identified an offside.

Should Digne have been sent off?

Would the VAR have stepped in to show a red card to Digne for serious foul play with his late challenge on Jacob Murphy? It is far from certain from what we have seen in the Premier League.

We often hear the VAR has referenced glancing contact to uphold the decison of a yellow card. See Diogo Dalot's challenge on Jeremy Doku in the Manchester derby last month.

Digne did come in at some speed and that would have increased the chance of being sent off on review.

Yet the Frenchman did not push through on to the shin of the Newcastle player. That his foot came off quickly probably would have saved him.

It may well have been one of those where the on-field decision would have stood, whether it was yellow or red card.

Serious foul play or denying an obvious goalscoring opportunity (Dogso)?

Really, this incident could have been either. After all, Bizot brought down Murphy with a knee-high challenge - although it was not with studs leading.

When the Dutch goalkeeper fouled the Newcastle forward, the Magpies were left with three attackers up against only Luiz, although Dogso could only be applied to the player fouled.

The VAR would have taken into account the general run of the ball was not towards goal. They would also consider if Luiz would have been able to get across to prevent the shot.

You can make a case for a degree of doubt for Dogso. But much like the Digne decision it is one which would likely have stayed with the on-field decision.

Read more analysis on the officiating in Aston Villa v Newcastle here

title: Virgil van Dijk responds to questions over Mohamed Salah‚Äôs Liverpool future
description: Salah scored and assisted in Saturday‚Äôs 3-0 FA Cup win over Brighton and has a further season on his contract, with Van Dijk hoping he remains at Anfield
fullText:
Virgil van Dijk said he ‚Äúalways‚Äù wants Mohamed Salah to stay at Liverpool amid questions if the winger will be at Anfield next season.

Salah brought his future on Merseyside into doubt in December with an explosive interview when he accused the club of throwing him under the bus and breaking promises to him.

But while he was then omitted from the squad for the Champions League game at Inter Milan, relations were repaired to the extent that he has started all seven games since his return from the Africa Cup of Nations.

He scored and assisted in Saturday‚Äôs 3-0 FA Cup win over Brighton and has a further season on his contract, with Van Dijk hoping he remains at Anfield.

He explained: ‚ÄúI always want Mo to stay because I'm a good friend of him and we've been through the highs and not-so-highs ‚Äì I don't want to call them lows - together for so many years. The same as me, he's got one more year [on his current deal], so we will see.

‚ÄúI think Mo is still so important for us. Last week he had an assist again and broke another record and he is still the leader and important for me personally, as a captain, to have around and to have him on the pitch and his presence benefits the team. He also has to just keep going.‚Äù

Salah‚Äôs goal against Brighton was just his second in his last 13 appearances for Liverpool but Van Dijk added: ‚ÄúHe always gives the team more than goals. There's obviously a lot of focus on his goals at the moment and that's also part of his life because he puts the standards so extremely high when he doesn't score as much he gets criticised. He has to stay calm and try to be important with everything he still can do and there is so much still he is important for us on and off the pitch.

‚ÄúLet's see for the rest of the season how important he still is and can be and the rest of the team will hopefully be successful but there is still a long way to go.‚Äù

title: Where to live stream the NBA All-Star Game: Schedule, start time, format & rosters for 2026
description: Here's what you need to know for the streaming options for the NBA All-Star Game
fullText:
Where to live stream the NBA All-Star Game: Schedule, start time, format & rosters for 2026 originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The NBA is heading into a new era as the league‚Äôs midseason showcase officially moves to NBC and Peacock for the first time in over two decades.

The world's best basketball talent will converge at the high-tech Intuit Dome in Los Angeles for the 75th NBA All-Star Game. This year, the league has ditched the traditional East vs. West showdown in favor of a high-stakes "U.S. vs. World" tournament, designed to inject fresh energy into a weekend that has seen viewership fluctuate in recent years.

The new format features a three-team, round-robin tournament consisting of four independent 12-minute games. Two U.S. rosters will compete against a powerhouse World Team led by Giannis Antetokounmpo, Nikola Jokic, and Victor Wembanyama. After three round-robin matches, the top two teams will advance to a championship final to decide which roster reigns supreme.

Here's how to live stream the game.

MORE:¬†NBA All-Star rosters 2026

For the first time in 20 years, the All-Star game will be aired on NBC.

Events throughout NBA All-Star Weekend will air live on NBC¬†and¬†can also be streamed on¬†Peacock. Peacock‚Äôs sports programming features live coverage of NFL Sunday Night Football, the NBA, Olympic and Paralympic Games, Big Ten football and basketball, Notre Dame football, Big East and Big 12 basketball, Premier League soccer, golf, and more.

The NBA All-Star Game is set to begin at approximately 5 p.m. ET on Sunday, Feb. 15. The game will be played at the Intuit Dome in Inglewood, the state-of-the-art new home of the Los Angeles Clippers.

title: NBA All-Star Game announcers: Who's calling the 2026 edition on NBC?
description: For the first time in 24 years, NBC will air the NBA All-Star Game. Here's who's on the call.
fullText:
After nearly a quarter-century, the NBA All-Star Game is back on NBC.

Noah Eagle (play-by-play), Reggie Miller (analyst), Jamal Crawford (analyst), Zora Stephenson (courtside reporter) and Ashley ShahAhmadi(courtside reporter) will be on the call when the All-Star Game tips off at 5 p.m. ET. NBC's last NBA All-Star Game came in 2022, when the late, great Kobe Bryant won MVP for his 31-point performance against Allen Iverson and the East.

Gone are the days of conference showdowns like those, though, as a new format will debut in addition to the broadcasting shakeup. This year, two U.S. teams and one World team will compete in a round-robin tournament featuring four 12-minute games.

NBC's first All-Star Game in 24 years takes place at the Intuit Dome, home of the Los Angeles Clippers. It should be a fun one!

This article originally appeared on For The Win: NBA All-Star Game announcers: Who's calling the 2026 edition on NBC?

title: Captain Van Dijk wants 'so important' Salah to stay
description: Liverpool captain hails the importance of Mohamed Salah, why the Egyptian brings more than goals and his desire for Salah to stay beyond the summer
fullText:
Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk says he "always wants" Mohamed Salah to stay at the club after the Egyptian starred in their FA Cup win over Brighton.

The 33-year-old scored and provided an assist as Liverpool claimed a 3-0 win to move into the fifth round.

In December, Salah said he had been "thrown under the bus" by the club and that his relationship with head coach Arne Slot had broken down amid a difficult run of form.

However, since returning from the Africa Cup of Nations in January, the 33-year-old has started every Liverpool game, scoring twice and making four assists.

Salah's current deal expires in 2027 and there is the possibility of him moving on this summer after nine years at Liverpool.

Al-Ittihad tried to sign Salah in 2023 and the Saudi Pro League would still be interested if Salah is available.

Van Dijk pointed to Salah still breaking records for Liverpool - his assist against Sunderland last week means he has the joint-most Premier League assists for the club, level with Steven Gerrard on 92.

"Mo is still a leader and important for me, as a captain, to have around and to have him on the pitch and his presence benefits the team," Van Dijk, 34, said.

"He always gives the team more than goals. There's obviously a lot of focus on his goals at the moment because he puts the standards so extremely high, so when he doesn't score as much he gets criticised."

Before Saturday, Salah had scored just once in his previous 12 games for Liverpool.

His penalty against Brighton was his seventh Reds goal of the season - last term Salah scored 34 goals for Arne Slot's side as they lifted the Premier League title and he has 252 goals in total since joining Liverpool in 2017.

Van Dijk signed a new two-year contract a week after Salah extended his own contract in April.

The Dutchman has also struggled for form this season, with Liverpool sixth in the Premier League with just 12 wins from their 26 matches.

"[Mo is] the same as me - he's got one more year [left on his contract] so we will see," Van Dijk added.

"I always want Mo to stay because I'm a good friend of his and we've been through the highs and not-so-highs - I don't want to call them lows - together for so many years.

"Mo is a very important Liverpool player who has set the bar extremely high. I can only say for us nothing has changed.

"There are so many things people don't see what is important to try to become a successful team. Let's see for the rest of the season how important he still is and can be."

title: How to watch Sixers' Tyrese Maxey in the 2026 NBA All-Star game

fullText:

The All-Star format is an interesting one in 2026. The NBA decided to switch things up and have a USA vs. World type of format in a round-robin tournament. There are two separate USA teams, one named Stars and the other named Stripes, and they will compete in a tournament with the World team to determine the winner on Sunday night. title: Mamadou Sarr enters exclusive Chelsea company alongside Deco and Gonzalo Higuain
description: Liam Rosenior made the bold call to hand Mamadou Sarr a start against Hull City, and it paid off as the young defender played a key role in Chelsea‚Äôs 4-0 win on Friday night. The Senegalese prospect may still be a mystery to many Chelsea supporters, but not to Rosenior.
fullText:
Liam Rosenior made the bold call to hand Mamadou Sarr a start against Hull City, and it paid off as the young defender played a key role in Chelsea‚Äôs 4-0 win on Friday night.

The Senegalese prospect may still be a mystery to many Chelsea supporters, but not to Rosenior. The two already know each other well from Sarr‚Äôs loan spell under the Englishman at Strasbourg earlier in the season.

It has been quite the year for the 20-year-old. He joined Chelsea permanently last summer, took part in the Club World Cup, went back on loan to Strasbourg, won the African Cup of Nations with Senegal, and then returned to Stamford Bridge.

Friday marked just his second appearance for Chelsea. His debut came as a late substitute in the Club World Cup against ES Tunis, but this was his first time in the starting XI ‚Äì and he certainly grabbed attention.

Despite the game being against Championship opposition, Sarr‚Äôs passing numbers stood out. He completed 101 of his 103 passes, which is the most by any Chelsea centre-back this season.

It was also Rosenior‚Äôs third clean sheet in his 11th match in charge. Alan Shearer noted Sarr‚Äôs strong showing, and the win placed him among a rare group of players.

Over the past two decades, just four Chelsea players have debuted with a win by four goals or more. The Senegalese defender now joins that list alongside Gonzalo Higuain, Alvaro Morata and Deco.

Back in 1997, Gianluca Vialli made his first start for Chelsea in a similarly dominant fashion, helping his side to a 6-0 win over Barnsley at Stamford Bridge.

Deco‚Äôs first start came 11 years after Vialli‚Äôs debut, which was a 4-0 win over Portsmouth. The current Barcelona sporting director also hit the net with a stunning goal from distance.

Nine years later, Alvaro Morata added his name to the list by scoring a hat-trick in a 4-0 win against Stoke City after his move from Real Madrid.

Gonzalo Higuain followed soon after, finding the net twice in a 5-0 victory over Huddersfield Town. Now Sarr has joined that group, and it‚Äôs hard to imagine him making a better impression on his full debut.

The wild stat that puts Liam Rosenior ahead of any other Chelsea manager, including Carlo Ancelotti

Kendry Paez‚Äôs first River Plate outing sparks unified reaction among fans

title: Aaron Henry brings an impressive resume with him to Notre Dame‚Äôs DB‚Äôs
description: Notre Dame‚Äôs new secondary coach Aaron Henry coached one of the best cornerbacks in the NFL, and he‚Äôll bring that knowledge to South Bend.
fullText:
Devon Witherspoon made himself into a household name during Super Bowl 60, but his journey there was heavily influenced by one of Notre Dame‚Äôs newest coaches.

When stepping foot in Champaign, IL, Devon Witherspoon was a zero-star according to 247Sports, a scrawny recruit who barely weighed in at 155-pounds. However, then Illinois defensive backs coach Aaron Henry immediately saw something in him that others missed. ‚ÄúI really believe the Good Lord just creates people who are a little bit different, I saw that the first day I got to campus. There was no denying that. He played so hard. He was not ducking contact,‚Äù¬†he told FoxSports.

Henry knew Witherspoon wasn‚Äôt ready for Big Ten physicality and focused on reshaping Devon‚Äôs body and refine his game. Devon never said no to any challenges put forth to him.

The Seattle Seahawks ended up drafting Devon with the 5th overall pick in the NFL Draft. Three Pro Bowls later,¬† he has been arguably the heartbeat of the turnaround of the franchise who are now Super Bowl Champions.

As the new defensive back‚Äôs coach settles into South Bend, Aaron Henry will be able to walk into the locker room with immediate credibility. He was the man in charge when a zero-star corner worked his way from Champaign to Super Bowl champion.

#NewProfilePic pic.twitter.com/WDKGlludfX

‚Äî Aaron Henry (@AaronHenry7) February 7, 2026

Contact/Follow us¬†@IrishWireND¬†on X (Formerly Twitter), and like our page on Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Notre Dame news, notes, and opinions.

This article originally appeared on Fighting Irish Wire: Aaron Henry brings an impressive resume with him to Notre Dame

title: Nong-O To Face Asadula Imangazaliev For The Vacant ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Title At ONE Friday Fights 147
description: The Thai legend seeks his second ONE World Title against an unbeaten Russian knockout artist on March 20.
fullText:
A high-stakes World Title clash is set for ONE Friday Fights 147. Former long-time bantamweight Muay Thai king Nong-O Hama takes on undefeated Russian standout Asadula Imangazaliev for the vacant ONE Flyweight Muay Thai World Title inside Bangkok‚Äôs iconic Lumpinee Stadium.

The explosive showdown takes place on March 20, live in Asia primetime, pitting a living legend and a young superstar against each other.

Nong-O spent years establishing himself as one of the most dominant World Champions in ONE Championship history.

After winning the inaugural ONE Bantamweight Muay Thai World Title in 2019, he defended it a record seven times against top-flight opposition, blending sharp counters, clean combinations, and devastating finishing power.

His reign came to an end in a first-round knockout loss to Jonathan ‚ÄúThe General‚Äù Haggerty in April 2023, and although he picked up another win at bantamweight a year later, the 39-year-old began reassessing his long-term path as the division grew bigger and more physical.

That‚Äôs when he decided to move to flyweight, which presented a fresh opportunity.

At 135 pounds, Nong-O could lean more heavily on his speed, balance, and timing. His debut in the division came at ONE Fight Night 28 against Kongthoranee Sor Sommai in a closely contested bout. Despite that fight ending in a split decision loss, his performance showed he could immediately compete with the division‚Äôs elite.

Three months later at ONE Fight Night 31, the Evolve MMA representative returned with clear adjustments and defeated Kongthoranee by unanimous decision, controlling the tempo and displaying sharper movement across three fast-paced rounds in their rematch.

That victory carried significance. It confirmed Nong-O was not simply testing himself in a new weight class. He had recalibrated, and he had earned his place among the top contenders.

The Thai icon was initially scheduled to challenge for the flyweight Muay Thai crown at ONE 173 in November last year. However, after his opponent was not medically cleared to compete following the weigh-in and hydration test, the bout was shelved.

Now, Nong-O finds himself standing opposite a young contender on a seemingly flawless trajectory.

Imangazaliev‚Äôs path has been fueled by momentum. After making waves with five wins ‚Äì including four knockouts ‚Äì on ONE Championship‚Äôs weekly Asia primetime spectacle, he secured a main roster contract at ONE Friday Fights 122 with a first-round head-kick knockout of seven-time Muay Thai World Champion ‚ÄúThe Angel Warrior‚Äù Panpayak Jitmuangnon.

The finish instantly elevated the Team Mehdi Zatout product into serious contention.

He reinforced that status by stopping Kongthoranee in the second round at ONE Fight Night 39 this past January, extending his pristine record to 11-0, earning a US$50,000 performance bonus, and strengthening his claim for a World Title opportunity.

While Nong-O brings World Championship composure and years of elite experience, Imangazaliev arrives in this matchup with explosiveness, confidence, and an unblemished record.

With the flyweight Muay Thai belt vacant, ONE Friday Fights 147 will determine who gets to claim the division‚Äôs throne. Inside the hallowed ground of Lumpinee Stadium, a new king will be crowned.

title: Vote! Who should be Active Chiropractic boys Athlete of the Week?
description: This week's nominees are from Churchill, Elmira, North Eugene, Pleasant Hill, Springfield and Thurston.
fullText:
The OSAA winter postseason is officially underway, and athletes throughout the Eugene-Springfield have continued to deliver stellar performances on the big stage.

Every week, you get to vote for The Register-Guard's Athlete of the Week, sponsored by Active Chiropractic.

Here are the nominees for this week's boys Athlete of the Week:

Matteo Buhr, Springfield swimming

Quinn Devenport, Thurston swimming

Kaeden Garcia, Elmira basketball

Lucas LaBounty, Thurston basketball

Landen Melvin, Pleasant Hill basketball

Owen Metzger, North Eugene swimming

Ethan Regas, Thurston wrestling

Information about each nominee is listed below. Vote for the athlete you think is most deserving at registerguard.com/sports. The poll closes at 9 a.m. Thursday.

Springfield sophomore Matteo Buhr was the Millers' top scorer with 37 points Feb. 13 at the Midwestern League district championships at Warren H. Daugherty Aquatic Center in Cottage Grove.

Buhr won the 200-yard freestyle in 1 minute, 56.39 seconds and took second in the 100 butterfly (56.64).

Thurston senior Quinn Devenport won the 50 freestyle in 21.78 and the 100 freestyle in 48.56 to help the Colts capture the team title on Feb. 13 at the Midwestern League District Championships at Warren H. Daugherty Aquatic Center in Cottage Grove.

Devenport also swam legs on two relay teams.

Creswell senior guard Kaeden Garcia scored a team-high 24 points and tallied seven rebounds, three assists and two steals Feb. 10 to lead the Falcons to a 63-58 home win over Creswell.

Churchill sophomore Kyan Hood was the Lancers' top scorer with 32 points Feb. 13 at the Midwestern League district championships at Warren H. Daugherty Aquatic Center in Cottage Grove.

Hood took second in the 200 freestyle (1:44.45), fourth in the 100 breaststroke (1:08.00) and swam legs on two relay teams.

Thurston senior Lucas LaBounty scored a team-high 27 points on 12-of-18 shooting and grabbed a team-high nine rebounds Feb. 13 to lead the Class 5A No. 4 Colts to a 69-45 home win over No. 8 Crater.

Pleasant Hill senior Landen Melvin scored a team-high 26 points Feb. 10 to lead the Class 3A No. 2 Billies to a 65-61 double-overtime home win over Sisters.

North Eugene sophomore Owen Metzger was the Highlanders' top scorer with 36 points Feb. 13 at the Midwestern League district championships at Warren H. Daugherty Aquatic Center in Cottage Grove.

Metzger won the 500 freestyle (5:08.91), took third in the 100 butterfly (58.40) and swam legs on two relay teams.

Thurston sophomore Ethan Regas beat Crater defending state champion Jaret Hickey at 144 pounds Feb. 11 in a dual-meet loss to the Comets.

Regas won, 21-5, by technical fall.

Thurston junior Brody Wyatt won the 100 butterfly in 53.25 seconds and won the 100 backstroke in 52.07 and helped the Colts to the team title Feb. 13 at the Midwestern League district championships at Warren H. Daugherty Aquatic Center in Cottage Grove.

Wyatt also swam legs on two relay teams.

To submit an Athlete of the Week nomination, please email Register-Guard sports reporter Jarrid Denney at¬† ¬† ¬† jdenney@registerguard.com with the athlete's name, stats and any other relevant information about the performance they are being nominated for.

title: Olympic women's ice hockey semifinals: Bracket, schedule, how to watch
description: After a win over Italy in the quarterfinals, the United States women are in the final four. Here's the full bracket and schedule remaining.
fullText:
The U.S. women's hockey team has certainly built some momentum heading into the semifinals. Not only were they the only team in Group A to finish undefeated, but they handled Italy in their quarterfinals matchup, 6-0.

Now, the United States is waiting patiently. After two more games were played Saturday ‚Äî Canada vs. Germany, Finland vs. Switzerland ‚Äî the semifinals are set. The U.S. has reached the gold medal match in each of the last four Olympics and it is not looking to end its streak in Milan.

Here's the full bracket and schedule for the remainder of the women's ice hockey tournament at the 2026 Winter Olympic Games.

The women's ice hockey semifinals are set for Monday, Feb. 16. The first game of the day will take place at 10:40 a.m. ET, while the second semifinal game is set for 3:10 p.m. ET.

United States vs. Sweden, 10:40 a.m. ET

Canada vs. Switzerland, 3:10 p.m. ET

The bronze medal matchup will be played on Thursday, Feb. 19 at 8:40 a.m. ET. Coverage on USA Network will start at noon ET the same day.

The gold medal match takes place at 1:10 p.m. ET on Thursday, Feb. 19. Interested fans can watch the game on USA Network.

title: Giants' Jaxson Dart spoke with Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce about Matt Nagy
description: New York Giants QB Jaxson Dart has had multiple conversations with Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce about OC Matt Nagy.
fullText:
The New York Giants bolstered their offensive staff with the hiring of Matt Nagy as offensive coordinator, positioning him to guide second-year quarterback Jaxson Dart under head coach John Harbaugh.

Nagy, who previously coordinated for the Kansas City Chiefs alongside Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce‚Äîcontributing to multiple Super Bowl runs‚Äîbrings extensive experience after stints as the Chicago Bears head coach and earlier roles.

Dart, coming off an encouraging rookie campaign where he amassed 24 total touchdowns and just seven turnovers across starts, proactively sought insights on his new coordinator.

ESPN's Jordan Raanan reports that Dart engaged in multiple conversations with Mahomes about working with Nagy, emerging impressed by the feedback. During Super Bowl week, he also consulted Kelce, who offered glowing endorsements of his former play-caller.

Dart, fresh off a rookie season with 24 total touchdowns and seven turnovers, talked on multiple occasions with Mahomes about working with Nagy, according to multiple sources close to the QB. He came away impressed. He also told reporters last week that he spoke with Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce about his former coordinator and received rave reviews.

In an exclusive Forbes interview, Dart elaborated on his enthusiasm.

"I can‚Äôt wait to get the chance to play for him. Just so many great things that are said about him and his coaching style and the work that he puts in, the passion that he has for the game," he said.

Dart praised Nagy as a "quarterback guy" who prioritizes putting players "in the best situation and position to succeed," and tailors approaches to individual QBs. Dart noted Kelce "didn‚Äôt have anything but tremendous things to say about Coach Nags," reinforcing positive views from Chiefs stars.

Nagy's scheme aligns well with Dart's strengths, with minimal expected adjustments from prior systems.

This "loaded" staff, including other ex-caches and coordinators, signals the Giants' commitment to Dart's growth as they aim to elevate their offense.

This article originally appeared on Giants Wire: Giants' Jaxson Dart spoke with Patrick Mahomes, Travis Kelce about Matt Nagy

title: 2 Aggie freshmen help lead Texas A&M baseball's 2-0 start
description: Freshmen Nico Partida and Boston Kellner are making an immediate impact for Texas A&M, helping the Aggies to a 2-0 start and showing promise.
fullText:
No. 25 Texas A&M is 2-0 to start the 2026 season after defeating Tennessee Tech by a combined 38- 13 in the first two games of the Opening Weekend series, led by 33 hits and nearly double-digit home runs, including star outfielder Caden Sorrell's three homers, combined with Baylor transfer DH Wesley Jordan's two home runs to start off his Aggie career.

While the more experienced players, especially transfer Chris Hacopian, are making an immediate impact, second-year coach Michael Earley opted to start freshmen Nico Partida and Boston Kellner, and through two games, both players look the part, especially the Arizona native, who has recorded four hits and a team-leading four doubles, producing three RBI to start the season.

Suiting up and starting in the SEC as a freshman is a big deal, and thanks to several Texas A&M reporters, including KBTX's Travis Brown, Kellner's parents drove over 20 hours to watch their son play, which must have been one of the more exciting moments after years of driving him to practice.

One of Earley's top commits, Kellner was named USA's 2024 National High School Underclass Player of the Year, and was considered a candidate to earn a starting infield spot at either shortstop or second base. After hiring Cliff Pennington to coach the infield, Kellner and Partida's starting futures were set in stone.

Nico Partida, who was highly regarded as an elite pitching prospect, was equally dangerous at the plate and was one of the better athletes coming into the program. Ranked as the 144th-ranked prospect in the 2025 MLB Draft, Partida withdrew his name and opted to play for Michael Earley, starting his career at third base due to Kellner's natural fit at shortstop. Through two games, Partida hit his first career home run on Friday night.

Standing 6'0" and over 200 pounds, Kellner is plenty powerful after hitting 29 home runs and hitting over .400 during his high school career, but his patience at the plate, focused on hits rather than homers, pairs well with Caden Sorrell and Gavin Grahovac, who have the ability to knock the ball out of the park at any time.

For Texas A&M to get back to the NCAA Tournament after missing the postseason for the first time in nearly 20 seasons, Kellner and Partida will have moments of struggle, and if the hits aren't coming, I don't expect their defensive performances to derail. So far, so good.

Seeing double(s) ‚ÄºÔ∏è

Boston Kellner with his third double of the week, 2 RBI double run here!#NCAABaseball x üé• SECN+ / @AggieBaseball pic.twitter.com/f1TLlrL1c8

‚Äî NCAA Baseball (@NCAABaseball) February 14, 2026

Contact/Follow us¬†@AggiesWire¬†on X¬†(formerly Twitter) and like our page on¬†Facebook¬†to follow ongoing coverage of Texas A&M news, notes and opinions.¬†Follow Cameron on X:¬†@CameronOhnysty.

title: What was the most disappointing Lions draft pick of all time?
description: Breaking down the biggest disappointing Detroit Lions draft picks in team history.
fullText:
With the NFL Combine just over a week away, it‚Äôs time to start thinking about the 2026 NFL Draft. We‚Äôve dipped our toe into the pool of prospects with our weekly Mock Draft roundups, but things will really start to ramp up in the next few weeks.

But before we look forward to this April‚Äôs draft, let‚Äôs take a moment to look back. Every year, there are player we‚Äôre certain are going to work out that don‚Äôt. And there are draft picks we are sure will be busts who shock fans with how impressive they are.

The Lions draft history is littered with disappointments‚Äîalthough most of those came before this current regime. Today‚Äôs Question of the Day is:

My answer: Any time you talk disappointing picks, I think the discussion has to start with franchise quarterbacks who never lived up to their draft status. Joey Harrington, the third overall pick in the 2022 NFL Draft has to be near the top of this list after lasting just four years, completing just 54.7% of his passes, averaging a 68.1 passer rating, and amassing a 18-37 record. Andre Ware was an even bigger bust. The seventh overall pick in 1990 ended up just starting six career games for the Lions after failing to beat out Rodney Peete and Erik Kramer for most of his career.

Outside of the quarterback position, Charles Rogers is part of this conversation. The second overall pick in 2023, Rogers had a promising rookie season before suffering a broken clavicle that ended his year just five games in. He would never look the same again, with suspensions and reported lack of effort ending his career abruptly.

Personally speaking, I‚Äôm not sure there was a more disappointing draft pick result in the modern era than Jeff Okudah. I had very high hopes for the Lions first-round cornerback who many believed was a can‚Äôt-miss pick. Injuries derailed his career early, but he also just never lived up to the billing of the third overall selection. Though he remains in the league now, he hasn‚Äôt started a game since 2023, and he only played in 25 for Detroit before they traded him away.

Which Lions draft pick in franchise history was the most disappointing to you? Share your thoughts in the comment section below.

title: 21yo explains why he left Arsenal after the January deadline
description: Arsenal‚Äôs Charles Sagoe Jr. has explained why he decided this week to join Kalmar FF on an unconventional loan lasting until January 2027.Photo via Sagoe Jr. on InstagramOver a week after the Premie...
fullText:
Over a week after the Premier League‚Äôs January transfer window deadline, Arsenal youngster Charles Sagoe Jr. confirmed a loan move to Swedish side Kalmar FF lasting until January 2027.

The Swedish Allsvenskan runs on a calendar-year basis kicking off in April, and their transfer window doesn‚Äôt close until the end of March, hence the unusual loan period and the late confirmation of the move.

Kalmar will be involved in the Swedish Cup before that though, with three group stage games planned for February 21st, March 1st, and March 8th.

As for why Sagoe Jr. made the transfer, he explained his reasoning in an interview with Fotbollskanalen.

‚ÄúI felt I needed a fresh start and an opportunity to show what I can do,‚Äù Sagoe Jr. said (via Sport Witness).

‚ÄúWhen I found out that Kalmar was interested in me, I did my research. I spoke with the sporting director, the coach, and others at the club. Everyone spoke so highly of the club and how hard everyone here works to develop. It felt like the right place for me to develop into first-team football.

‚ÄúI will always be eternally grateful that I became part of Arsenal at such a young age. The club has constantly shaped me, pushed me, and given me the opportunity to improve at all levels. I hope to take a lot of that with me to this loan spell in Kalmar.‚Äù

Sagoe Jr. has been having a positive season with the Arsenal u21s up to this point, scoring five and assisting a further seven in his 14 appearances for the side.

But the 21-year-old made his senior debut for Arsenal well over two years ago now, and he really needs more first-team opportunities. Kalmar should offer him plenty over the next 12 months.

Sagoe Jr. will then have a decision to make on his Arsenal future, with reports suggesting his current deal expires in June 2027.

fullText:
Mikaela Shiffrin giant slalom live results, updates, highlights from 2026 Olympic women's skiing finals originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Over halfway through the Winter Olympics, Mikaela Shiffrin hasn't had the opportunity to earn an individual medal.

That will change on Sunday, as Shiffrin will compete in the Women's Gianl Slalom, her second event of the Olympics thus far. Shiffrin previously teamed up with Breezy Johnson in the Albine Skiing Team Combined, but this is the first time she will be on her own.

Shiffrin has a strong history in the Giant Slolum even, winning a gold medal in 2018 and finishing 5th in 2014. However, in 2022, Shiffrin didn't finish her first run, which was one of multiple DNF's that she had in Beijing.

title: Nottingham Forest confirm Vitor Pereira as fourth manager of season after Sean Dyche sacking
description: Former Wolves boss Pereira arrives with the club precariously placed above the drop zone and European commitments to contend with
fullText:
Nottingham Forest have appointed Vitor Pereira as their fourth manager of the season following the sacking of Sean Dyche, with the Portuguese signing an 18-month contract as he looks to steer the club away from Premier League relegation.

Former Wolves boss Pereira arrives at the City Ground tasked with guiding Forest away from the drop zone. Forest are precariously placed in 17th in the table, three points above a West Ham side growing in confidence.

Pereira was sacked from his post at Molineux in November after 11 months in charge, leaving the Midlands club with only two points from their first 10 Premier League games of the season.

He previously worked under Forest owner Evangelos Marinakis at Olympiacos, guiding the Greek giants to a league and cup double in 2014/15.

The Portuguese follows Dyche, Ange Postecoglou and Nuno Espirito Santo of those who have been and gone in the Forest dugout this term.

Nuno was dismissed at the beginning of the season, less than four months from guiding Forest to European qualification for the first time in 30 years, after his relationship with Marinakis and the club hierarchy deteriorated rapidly.

Postecoglou was appointed his successor, taking the reins after being sacked from Tottenham in the summer, but his reign proved ill-fated as he lasted just 39 days, failing to win any of his eight games in charge.

Dyche was brought in to steer the ship towards safety and helped lift Forest of the relegation zone, even being nominated for January‚Äôs manager of the month award.

However, performances remained subpar and he was let go in the wake of a 0-0 draw with bottom club Wolves on Wednesday night, after which his team were booed off at the final whistle by their own home crowd.

Pereira will be seen as a short-term solution at Forest, having left seven of his last nine roles within a year.

He has nevertheless been appointed off the back of his proven ability to avoid the drop, having done so with Wolves in 2024/25.

Pereira replaced Gary O'Neil with the objective of sparing the club from relegation in December 2024, with Wolves at the time sitting in 19th place with just nine points from 16 matches.

Wolves went on to comfortably survived demotion and ended the season 16th in the table, 17 points clear of 18th-placed Leicester City.

His first assignment as Forest boss will be in Europe as they travel to Fenerbahce - a club Pereira spent two spells with between 2015 and 2021 - in their Europa League knockout play-off on Thursday 19 February.

Forest will then play host to Liverpool, who they pummelled 3-0 at Anfield in what was the undoubted high point of Dyche‚Äôs reign, on Sunday 22 February.

Forest said Pereira will be joined by coaching staff Filipe Jorge Monteiro Almeida, Luis Miguel Moreira Da Silva, Bruno Filipe Araujo De Moura, and Pedro Simao Capela Silva Lopes.

title: Arsenal Starting XI vs Wigan: Confirmed Team News and Predicted Lineup
description: Arsenal predicted lineup vs Wigan: Rotation plans and injury latest before FA Cup clashArsenal‚Äôs predicted lineup for the FA Cup tie against Wigan reflects a familiar balancing act for Mikel Arteta,...
fullText:
Arsenal‚Äôs predicted lineup for the FA Cup tie against Wigan reflects a familiar balancing act for Mikel Arteta, whose side remain firmly in the Premier League title conversation while navigating a packed February calendar. Arteta is expected to rotate heavily at Emirates Stadium, preserving key starters ahead of trips to Wolves and Tottenham that could shape Arsenal‚Äôs league season.

Arsenal‚Äôs squad depth has improved under Arteta, yet fixture congestion still demands calculated decisions. The Gunners played Brentford days earlier and have little margin for fatigue, particularly with Manchester City and others setting relentless pace at the top. Arteta‚Äôs approach mirrors the pragmatic rotations seen across elite Premier League sides chasing silverware on multiple fronts.

A predicted 4-2-3-1 system has been widely suggested, with Kepa Arrizabalaga set to start in goal, offering continuity in domestic cups. Defensively, Ben White could return alongside Mosquera, Hincapie and Calafiori, giving minutes to players short of recent starts while protecting core starters for league action.

Arsenal‚Äôs injury latest remains central to team selection. Kai Havertz is ruled out with a muscle problem, while Mikel Merino faces a longer spell on the sidelines following foot surgery. William Saliba missed the Brentford match through illness, though that issue is understood to be short-term. Martin Odegaard also finished that match with knee discomfort, making him unlikely to feature in the cup tie.

These absences limit midfield options. Arteta may lean on Christian Norgaard alongside Myles Lewis-Skelly, offering a blend of control and youthful energy. Eberechi Eze, seeking consistency after recent struggles, could start in an advanced role.

For Arsenal, injury management is not merely precautionary; it is strategic. Recent Premier League history shows that title challenges often hinge on squad health. Liverpool‚Äôs near-miss seasons under Jurgen Klopp and Manchester City‚Äôs depth under Pep Guardiola offer contrasting lessons. Arteta appears determined to learn from both.

The predicted lineup circulating among reporters suggests:

Kepa; White, Mosquera, Hincapie, Calafiori; Norgaard, Lewis-Skelly; Madueke, Eze, Martinelli; Jesus.

This configuration would allow Gabriel Martinelli and Gabriel Jesus to regain rhythm, while Bukayo Saka, recently back from a hip issue, may be used cautiously from the bench. Arteta‚Äôs system demands relentless pressing and positional discipline, and fringe players must show they can execute those principles.

From a tactical perspective, Arsenal will expect territorial dominance. Wigan, currently in League One, will likely defend deep, inviting Arsenal‚Äôs wide players to stretch the pitch. The midfield pairing‚Äôs task will be to recycle possession quickly while guarding against counter-attacks, an area Arsenal have occasionally struggled with this season.

For analysts tracking Arsenal‚Äôs title push, performances in these matches reveal squad trust levels. Who Arteta selects, and how they perform, often predicts usage during decisive league fixtures.

Arsenal‚Äôs FA Cup history adds another layer. Arteta lifted the trophy early in his tenure, using it to build belief. With the title race tightening and Champions League ambitions alive, this competition offers both opportunity and risk.

Wigan arrive as underdogs, yet FA Cup shocks remain part of English football‚Äôs charm. Arsenal‚Äôs rotation policy must balance freshness with cohesion. Too many changes can disrupt rhythm; too few risk burnout.

For Arsenal supporters, the predicted lineup is less about one match and more about trajectory. Title races are decided over months, not moments, and every selection decision reflects the broader ambition to return Arsenal to domestic dominance.

title: Bayern's Neuer out 'for time being' two weeks before Dortmund topper
description: Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer has suffered a calf muscle injury and could miss the Bundesliga table topper at Borussia Dortmund in a fortnight. Bayern said on Sunday that team captain Neuer tore a muscle fibre in his left calf during a 3-0 victory at Werder Bremen the previous day and would be out of action "for the time being.
fullText:
Bayern Munich goalkeeper Manuel Neuer has suffered a calf muscle injury and could miss the Bundesliga table topper at Borussia Dortmund in a fortnight.

Bayern said on Sunday that team captain Neuer tore a muscle fibre in his left calf during a 3-0 victory at Werder Bremen the previous day and would be out of action "for the time being."

An injury of this kind is normally not cured in two weeks.

Jonas Urbig replaced Neuer at half-time in Bremen and is also set to play next Saturday against Eintracht Frankfurt.

The match in Dortmund follows on February 28. Bayern top the table six points ahead of Dortmund, who before Der Klassiker face a difficult visit to RB Leipzig.

title: GB curlers sweep aside Germany to edge closer to semis
description: Team GB's men's curlers move a step closer to securing a Winter Olympics semi-final place as they compile an accomplished victory over Germany.
fullText:
Team GB's men's curlers took a step closer to securing a Winter Olympics semi-final place as they compiled an accomplished victory over Germany.

Bruce Mouat's world champions have now won four of their opening five matches in northern Italy, with six victories almost certain to guarantee a place in the last four and a shot at the medals.

The Scottish quartet beat their German counterparts in both the European and the World Championships last year and were rarely in danger here.

Level at 2-2 after three ends, the British rink moved smoothly into a 5-2 advantage at the interval, then accelerated clear with a further steal of two in the seventh end.

Germany were floundering at that stage and, although they cut the deficit, Mouat closed out another couple in the ninth end to secure the win.

The men are back on the ice later on Sunday, against the unbeaten Switzerland (18:05 GMT).

Before then, the GB women will play their fourth match, with the fancied Sweden their opponents (13:05) as they try to revive their own semi-final hopes.

Adele Nicoll made history by becoming the first British woman to compete in the monobob at the Olympics and sits 13th at the halfway point at the Cortina sliding track.

The 29-year-old clocked a time of 2:00:83 over the two heats, 1.71 seconds off Germany's Laura Nolte in top spot.

It is unlikely Nicoll will trouble the medals but a top-10 finish would likely represent a successful Games for the Welsh slider, who was a travelling reserve for the Beijing 2022 Games but will also contest the two-woman event at Milan-Cortina.

"I was more nervous than maybe I'd realised for the first run and I felt a little bit like jelly on the block," she said.

"Seeing the Milan-Cortina Olympic rings was really surreal and emotional. These were all first experiences, I just wanted to do myself proud."

Nicoll is also a three-time British shot put champion and is targeting an appearance at the Commonwealth Games in Glasgow this summer.

Meanwhile, Mica Moore, who represented Team GB four years ago but has since opted to compete for Jamaica, sits 15th on 2:00:98 before Monday's medal-deciding heats.

title: Redemption for Kingsbury with maiden dual moguls Olympic gold
description: Canadian legend Mikael Kingsbury won the inaugural Olympic dual moguls gold medal on Sunday after narrowly missing out in the individual event. Kingsbury won the final against Japan's individual event world champion Ikuma Horishima who lost control in the main moguls section and fluffed his second jump.
fullText:
Canadian legend Mikael Kingsbury won the inaugural Olympic dual moguls gold medal on Sunday after narrowly missing out in the individual event.

Kingsbury won the final against Japan's individual event world champion Ikuma Horishima who lost control in the main moguls section and fluffed his second jump. The official score was 30-5.

Australia's Matt Graham beat Japan's Takuya Shimakawa in the small final to earn bronze.

The gold for Kingsbury came after he had lost the individual gold on Thursday against Australian Cooper Woods on countback after both had tied on points.

Kingsbury now has two golds and three silvers from four Olympics, and the 33-year-old is also a nine-time world champion.

Hirishima added silver to bronze from Thursday and 2022. Woods went out in the round of 16.

In the dual moguls, skiers compete against each other on one course in elimination rounds, with points awarded for speed, turns and jumps.

title: Sweden's Ponsiluoma gets pursuit gold after Jacquelin falters
description: Martin Ponsiluoma claimed Olympic biathlon pursuit gold for Sweden on Sunday after French skier Emilien Jacquelin misfired when it mattered. Former sprint and relay world champion Ponsiluoma had one penalty lap as he rose from seventh in the sprint to the gold, after mass start silver from 2022.
fullText:
Martin Ponsiluoma claimed Olympic biathlon pursuit gold for Sweden on Sunday after French skier Emilien Jacquelin misfired when it mattered.

Former sprint and relay world champion Ponsiluoma had one penalty lap as he rose from seventh in the sprint to the gold, after mass start silver from 2022.

He won the race over 12.5 kilometres 20.6 seconds from Norway's Sturla Holm L√¶greid, who added silver to sprint and 20km bronze with two missed targets.

Jacquelin missed the sprint bronze by two-tenths of a second but seemed on course towards redemption when he held a big lead going into the final shooting.

But there the twice former pursuit world champion missed two targets and the penalty loops allowed Ponsiluomo to go top. Jacquelin at least got bronze with three missed targets overall, 29.7 seconds off the pace.

Sprint winner Quentin Fillon Maillet of France faded to seventh with five missed targets.

In the pursuit, athletes start based on their time difference from the sprint. The women's race was scheduled for later Sunday.

title: Why Mirko Cro Cop called weight cutting MMA‚Äôs ‚Äòbiggest scam‚Äô during Conor McGregor‚Äôs rise
description: Mirko Cro Cop has made it clear he prefers fighters to step into the cage at their natural weight, rather than cut down. Weight cutting remains a hot topic across the UFC and mixed martial arts in general.
fullText:
Mirko Cro Cop has made it clear he prefers fighters to step into the cage at their natural weight, rather than cut down.

Weight cutting remains a hot topic across the UFC and mixed martial arts in general.

Most fighters do not compete close to their natural size, opting instead for harsh and often risky cuts to gain an edge on fight night.

Conor McGregor was one of the many fighters who built his reputation while cutting weight. He looked drastically different when weighing in as a featherweight, where he captured his first UFC belt.

McGregor stunned the world at UFC 194, needing just 13 seconds to knock out Jose Aldo with a single punch.

The Irishman had a major size advantage over Aldo and didn‚Äôt fight again at 145 pounds after winning the title.

Instead, he made his welterweight debut before later claiming lightweight gold, becoming the first-ever simultaneous two-division champion in UFC history.

But for Cro Cop, how McGregor achieved those titles takes some of the shine off them.

In 2023, he told Index Video: ‚ÄúNowadays, the biggest scam in MMA is weight cutting. That‚Äôs the biggest scam in combat sports.

‚ÄúPeople need this explained because they don‚Äôt understand, being in a clinch with someone your own weight, five kilos lighter or 10 kilos heavier, that‚Äôs a night and day difference.

‚ÄúThe rules are crazy‚Ä¶and then you see double champions,‚Äù he continued. ‚ÄúDouble champions of what? For example, Conor McGregor. He weighs around 83-84 kilos‚Ä¶when he had the fight with Jose Aldo, he had 66 kilos on the scale and made the weight, but in the fight he had 78 kilos in the 66-kilo weight class.

‚ÄúThen he goes for a challenge, weighing over 80 kilos‚Ä¶ He will go for the 70-kilo belt. Wait a second, while having 84 kilos?

‚ÄúOkay buddy, now fight at middleweight and win the belt there. You want to be a double champion? A legend? Then move up to light heavyweight and prove how tough you are.‚Äù

It is still early in the year, but weight cutting has already become a major topic again in the UFC.

The issue drew attention on January 23 after Cameron Smotherman fainted at the weigh-ins for UFC 324.

Although he made weight, Smotherman collapsed after stepping off the scale, which resulted in his fight being called off.

In the lead-up to UFC Vegas 113, main event fighter Vinicius Oliveira opened up about his drastic cut to make bantamweight.

Oliveira began his camp 50 pounds over the division limit and still needed to lose 30 pounds as fight week approached. It is another example of how extreme cuts are still part of this sport.

What Islam Makhachev thinks Anthony Joshua needs to ‚Äòimprove‚Äô to dominate in MMA

UFC fans remain split on Jon Jones‚Äô legacy as drug test history lingers

title: Arne Slot has let one summer signing down massively
description: Mamardashvili overlooked once again by SlotWhen the Georgian signed for Liverpool he will have known it would be very difficult to usurp Alisson Becker‚Äôs place in the team, with the Brazilian alread...
fullText:
When the Georgian signed for Liverpool he will have known it would be very difficult to usurp Alisson Becker‚Äôs place in the team, with the Brazilian already established as one of the best ‚Äòkeepers in world football.

Nevertheless, the 25-year-old will have expected to receive several opportunities to earn his place in the team, but so far those opportunities have been lacking.

Mamardashvili has featured 11 times in all competitions for the Reds, and nine of those appearances came in a run from late September to early November when Alisson was injured.

The Georgian also made the team for Liverpool‚Äôs third round Carabao Cup tie against Southampton and the Reds‚Äô opening FA Cup fixture against Barnsley.

The match against Barnsley is the only time Mamardashvili has featured since Liverpool‚Äôs number one returned from injury.

Many supporters were expecting Mamardashvili to be named in the starting XI for the Reds‚Äô fourth round FA Cup tie against Brighton on Saturday, but Alisson retained his place in the team.

That selection decision will presumably set the precedent for the rest of the season, and it now looks like the only way the Georgian will get on the pitch is an injury to Alisson.

When Liverpool announced the ¬£25 million signing of Mamardashvili, the ‚Äòkeeper was one of the most sought-after young players in his position and was viewed by many as the long-term heir to Alisson.

Now, less than a year into his career at Anfield, there are serious doubts over his future in Merseyside, and links to other ‚Äòkeepers such as Sunderland's Robin Roefs have emerged.

title: Van Dijk: ‚ÄúI always want Mo to stay‚Äù
description: Van Dijk Backs Salah After Brighton Win as Liverpool Face Crucial Weeks Under SlotLiverpool captain Virgil van Dijk used the calm authority of a senior figure to deliver a clear message following the ...
fullText:
Liverpool captain Virgil van Dijk used the calm authority of a senior figure to deliver a clear message following the FA Cup win over Brighton: Mohamed Salah remains central to Liverpool‚Äôs ambitions. Speaking after the 3-0 victory reported by BBC Sport, van Dijk stressed both friendship and footballing necessity.

‚ÄúMo is still a leader and important for me, as a captain, to have around and to have him on the pitch and his presence benefits the team,‚Äù he said.

That message matters in a season shaped by transition under Arne Slot, with Liverpool balancing cup progress against uneven Premier League form. Salah‚Äôs goal and assist against Brighton served as a reminder that even in quieter spells, elite forwards often produce decisive moments. For Anfield Index readers tracking Liverpool‚Äôs xG swings and attacking output, this was another data point: Salah still drives Liverpool‚Äôs final-third productivity.

Mohamed Salah of Liverpool scores to make it 3-0 and celebrates Liverpool v Brighton and Hove Albion, Emirates FA Cup, Fourth Round, Football, Anfield, Liverpool, UK ‚Äì 14 Feb 2026Liverpool Anfield United Kingdom EDITORIAL USE ONLY No use with unauthorised audio, video, data, fixture lists, club/league logos or live services. Online in-match use limited to 120 images, no video emulation. No use in betting, games or single club/league/player publications. PUBLICATIONxINxGERxSUIxAUTxHUNxGRExMLTxCYPxROUxBULxUAExKSAxCHNxDENxINDxITAxPORxESPxSWExTURxMEXxCOLxVENxPERxECUxBRAxARGxCHIxURUxPARxPANxONLY Copyright: xPaulxCurrie/Shutterstockx 16608525az

Van Dijk was quick to push back against criticism of Salah‚Äôs recent scoring dip, reminding observers that elite forwards are judged against extraordinary standards.

‚ÄúHe always gives the team more than goals. There‚Äôs obviously a lot of focus on his goals at the moment because he puts the standards so extremely high, so when he doesn‚Äôt score as much he gets criticised.‚Äù

Against Brighton, Salah‚Äôs involvement illustrated that point. His movement dragged defenders, his assist unlocked space, and his penalty settled nerves. Liverpool under Slot still rely heavily on Salah‚Äôs gravity ‚Äî a truth evident in shot-creation metrics and pressing triggers across recent matches.

For supporters analysing patterns from Sunderland through Brighton and into upcoming fixtures, Salah‚Äôs influence remains structural, not merely statistical.

Speculation over Salah‚Äôs future has lingered amid interest from Saudi Arabia and the approaching final years of his contract. Van Dijk acknowledged the uncertainty but framed it in pragmatic terms.

‚Äú[Mo is] the same as me ‚Äì he‚Äôs got one more year [left on his contract] so we will see,‚Äù he said.

Yet he also made his preference unmistakable.

‚ÄúI always want Mo to stay because I‚Äôm a good friend of his and we‚Äôve been through the highs and not-so-highs ‚Äì I don‚Äôt want to call them lows ‚Äì together for so many years.‚Äù

Such comments carry weight inside dressing rooms. Leaders rarely speak casually about teammates‚Äô futures. Salah‚Äôs 252 Liverpool goals and record-equalling assist tally alongside Steven Gerrard underline his historical significance, and losing him would reshape Liverpool‚Äôs attack as dramatically as any tactical tweak Slot might attempt.

Liverpool‚Äôs sixth-place league position, with 12 wins from 26 matches, reflects the challenge facing Slot in his first season. Van Dijk‚Äôs remarks about Salah were also a defence of continuity amid change.

‚ÄúMo is a very important Liverpool player who has set the bar extremely high. I can only say for us nothing has changed.‚Äù

He added a reminder of unseen work behind the scenes.

‚ÄúThere are so many things people don‚Äôt see what is important to try to become a successful team. Let‚Äôs see for the rest of the season how important he still is and can be.‚Äù

For Liverpool, Brighton was both a result and a signal. Salah‚Äôs quality endures. Van Dijk‚Äôs leadership remains steady. Slot‚Äôs rebuild continues.

title: Odegaard explains how Brentford stopped them from winning
description: Martin Odegaard was introduced from the bench in Arsenal‚Äôs Premier League clash against Brentford in midweek, but he was ultimately unable to inspire his side to victory. Upon entering the pitch, he...
fullText:
Martin Odegaard was introduced from the bench in Arsenal‚Äôs Premier League clash against Brentford in midweek, but he was ultimately unable to inspire his side to victory. Upon entering the pitch, he made an immediate impact and helped the Gunners take the lead against determined opposition.

The match carried added significance after Manchester City had secured victory in their own fixture the previous day, increasing the pressure on Arsenal to respond with three points. The Gunners pushed to extend their advantage, fully aware of the risks associated with a narrow 1 0 scoreline. Despite their efforts, they were unable to find a second goal to put the contest beyond doubt.

Brentford, known for their resilience, capitalised and scored the next and decisive goal of the match. Arsenal continued to search for a late winner and created opportunities in the closing stages, yet they failed to convert their chances and were forced to settle for a single point. With the season approaching its conclusion and Manchester City close behind in the title race, it was not the result Arsenal would have hoped for.

Odegaard addressed the outcome in his customary programme notes before a home fixture. As reported by Arsenal Media, he wrote, ‚ÄúWe were looking strong but then the game changed again. Brentford played to their strengths and made it hard for us, as they have done to many teams all season. We needed to carry on playing how we had been before we scored the goal, so it was frustrating that we couldn‚Äôt do that. We should have been better at not conceding too many set pieces and throw ins, and then we need to do better when the ball comes into the box ‚Äì myself first.‚Äù

Martin Odegaard v Brentford. (Photo by Mike Hewitt/Getty Images)

His remarks explain the fine margins at this stage of the campaign. Arsenal remain in contention, but with Manchester City maintaining close pursuit, every dropped point carries significant weight in the battle for the Premier League crown.

title: Sheffield United Manager Praises ‚ÄúTop‚Äù Mentality After Late Win
description: Sheffield United left it late to snatch all three points against Portsmouth at Fratton Park on Saturday afternoon, as a dramatic 90th-minute winner sealed a 1-0 victory for the Blades.It was the hosts...
fullText:
Sheffield United left it late to snatch all three points against Portsmouth at Fratton Park on Saturday afternoon, as a dramatic 90th-minute winner sealed a 1-0 victory for the Blades.

It was the hosts who fashioned the first opportunity of the afternoon. Ebou Adams rose highest inside the penalty area but could only guide his header over the bar, setting the tone for a lively opening spell in which Portsmouth looked sharp and purposeful.

United responded swiftly and almost broke the deadlock through Gustavo Hamer. The midfielder struck a low effort from a tight angle that beat the goalkeeper but cannoned off the outside of the post, much to the relief of the home support.

Chances remained at a premium, but the contest sprang back into life shortly after the interval. The home side came within a whisker of the opener six minutes after the restart when a cleverly worked corner routine saw Segecic drill a low pass to Swift on the edge of the area. His curling strike drifted agonisingly wide of the upright, with the Blades scrambling to regain their composure.

As the game wore on, it became increasingly scrappy. United gradually grew into the contest, showing greater control and composure in possession, though clear-cut openings were few and far between. With the clock ticking down, the match appeared destined for a stalemate.

But the decisive moment arrived in the 90th minute. Tyrese Campbell showed tremendous determination to keep the ball alive on the left flank, squeezing a cross towards the back post. Arriving at precisely the right time, Andre Brooks applied the finishing touch from close range to spark wild celebrations among the travelling support.

PORTSMOUTH, ENGLAND ‚Äì FEBRUARY 14: John Swift of Portsmouth looks to get past Kalvin Phillips of Sheffield United during the Sky Bet Championship match between Portsmouth and Sheffield United at Fratton Park on February 14, 2026 in Portsmouth, England. (Photo by Charlie Crowhurst/Getty Images)

After the final whistle, speaking to SUTV, Blades boss Chris Wilder singled out his side‚Äôs mentality as the defining factor behind the result.

‚ÄúMentality, maybe over control and us imposing ourselves,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThey were better at what they did in the first half than what we did. They never put us to bed, and we grew into the game in the second half.

‚ÄúWe always thought at half-time, we talked about it, we can do a little bit better. I‚Äôm not sure they could do any better than that. We knew the game would settle down a little bit and it did.

‚ÄúMaybe I would have took a point with ten minutes to go and not been negative because this is a difficult place to come. To get a winner is brilliant for everybody, especially for our travelling fans.

‚ÄúThe performance wasn‚Äôt a great performance today, but the mentality was top. It allowed us to get something from the game. You just saw the attitude towards the end, when the seven minutes went up. Obviously, it always goes to eight and a half, nine. They saw it out. Coops didn‚Äôt really have to make any huge saves.

‚ÄúThey‚Äôll say that they‚Äôve missed some opportunities in the first half, but there was more pressure than create. From us, as I said, we had to dig a little bit deeper. It‚Äôs just Championship football at times, right the way through. I said it all along, 46 games. There‚Äôs some games you play really well, and you win. Some games where you dig in and get a result, and some games where you‚Äôre a little bit off of it. Maybe we‚Äôre a little bit off of it today, but to get something from these games is what picking up points is all about in the Championship.‚Äù

It was a hard-earned victory, and United‚Äôs first win at Fratton Park since 2003. Sheffield United are now just six points off the play-off spots.

title: Canada‚Äôs top three players are on their number one line
description: The Olympic men‚Äôs hockey tournament is generating some great excitement. One reason for that is Canada‚Äôs number one line. The three top Olympians in National Hockey League scoring are all on Team Canada, and played together against Switzerland on Friday.‚Ä¶
fullText:
The Olympic men‚Äôs hockey tournament is generating some great excitement. One reason for that is Canada‚Äôs number one line. The three top Olympians in National Hockey League scoring are all on Team Canada, and played together against Switzerland on Friday.

Canada‚Äôs exciting number one line consists of Edmonton Oilers centre Connor McDavid of Richmond Hill, Ontario, Colorado Avalanche centre Nathan MacKinnon of Halifax, Nova Scotia and San Jose Sharks centre Macklin Celebrini.

We are seeing an incredible combination of amazing speed from McDavid and Celebrini, and terrific power from MacKinnon. In Canada‚Äôs win over Switzerland, McDavid led Canada in scoring with three points.

McDavid opened the scoring with his first ever Olympic goal. That was followed by assists on goals by Thomas Harley and MacKinnon. There was also great excitement in the second period as MacKinnon set up Celebrini.

McDavid leads the NHL in scoring with 96 points. MacKinnon leads the NHL with 40 goals, and McDavid is tied for the NHL lead in assists with 62. McDavid has 96 points, MacKinnon has 93 points and Celebrini is fourth in the NHL with 81 points.

Nikita Kucherov of the Tampa Bay Lightning is third in the NHL in scoring with 91 points. However, he is not an Olympian because Russia is not part of the Olympic hockey program due to the war in Ukraine. Kucherov is also tied with McDavid in assists with 62.

The Canadians have France next to finish Group A. Canada has already clinched first place in the group, and are now focused on getting the number one seed heading into the medal round. Canada is a +9 after two games, while the 2-0 United States are at a +7.

title: Winter Olympics 2026: Norway's Johannes H√∏sflot Kl√¶bo sets record with 8th career gold medal
description: Kl√¶bo's gold medal is his fourth of the 2026 Milan Cortina Games.
fullText:
Norway cross-country skier Johannes H√∏sflot Kl√¶bo set a Winter Olympics record on Sunday by winning his ninth career gold medal.

Kl√¶bo, 29, earned his record as part of the men's 4 X 7.5 km relay team, which beat out France and home country Italy in the competition. Norway finished with a time of 1:04:24.5, 22 seconds ahead of France (1:04:46.7) and 47.9 seconds better than Italy (1:05:12.4).

The gold was his fourth of the 2026 Winter Olympics, joining his victories in the 10 km freestyle, 20 km skiathlon and the men's individual sprint.

Kl√¶bo previously won three gold medals at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games, finishing first in the individual sprint, 4 x 10 km relay and team sprint events. In 2022, he earned gold in the individual and team spring events at Beijing.

title: The highest scoring English players of all time as Kane hits historic 500-goal milestone
description: Harry Kane celebrated a milestone this weekend after reaching 500 career goals.The England captain scored twice inBayern Munich's 3-0 win at Werder Bremen to pass the 500-goal mark for club and countr...
fullText:
Harry Kane celebrated a milestone this weekend after reaching 500 career goals.

The England captain scored twice inBayern Munich's 3-0 win at Werder Bremen to pass the 500-goal mark for club and country.

"Really proud to reach 500 career goals. All these career milestones are something I'm really proud of. I try and take it in, I try and appreciate it,"he said on social media.

"Obviously, big thanks to all the teammates over the years, all the coaches and all the staff that have helped me to achieve it. As always, we look forward to the next game, the next goal. I can start racking up a few more and see how far we can get."

Kane has become the first Englishman to officially reach 500 career goals. We've listed the five highest scoring English footballers of all time.

Some might forget it, but football actually started before thePremier League.

Alan Shearer's all-time record in the Premier League is the stuff of legend, but he only makes it in at number five here.

Shearer scored 409 goals for club and country during his career, 283 of which came in England's top flight. During that period, he won three Premier League Golden Boots and becameNewcastle United's all-time record scorer.

Derby County's record scorer, Steve Bloomer scored 332 goals for The Rams over two spells with the club. Bloomer also represented Middlesbrough during a prolific career and scored 28 goals in just 23 caps for England.

Only Jimmy Greaves has scored more goals in England's top flight than Bloomer.

Jimmy Greaves scored a record-breaking 357 top-flight goals in England during a career in which the forward representedChelsea, Tottenham Hotspur and West Ham, alongside a short-lived spell in Italy at AC Milan.

Only Harry Kane has scored more goals for Spurs than Greaves, while he also notched up 44 goals in an England shirt. He was part of the squad that won the 1966 World Cup, but lost his place in the team to Geoff Hurst due to injury.

Dixie Dean's goalscoring feats are still spoken about almost 90 years since he last kicked a ball in England's top flight.

Dean scored a record-breaking 383 goals in 433 games forEverton, including a fabled 1927-28 season that is cemented in history.

That campaign, Dean scored a record 60 league goals in 39 games, an achievement unlikely to be eclipsed. The Birkenhead-born goal-getter also netted 18 times in just 16 appearances for England

Harry Kane is the first-ever Englishman to reach 500 career goals.

England's all-time record scorer has 78 goals in 112 caps for the Three Lions, having eclipsed Wayne Rooney's record in 2023.

Other notable achievements for Kane include being Tottenham Hotspur's leading goalscorer and the highest-scoring Englishman in Champions League history (45).

Now with Bayern Munich, he's bettered a goal-per-game in the Bundesliga, with 88 goals in 85 league appearances.

title: Russian figure skater Adeliia Petrosian is an Olympic mystery with big jumps and fitness concerns
description: Few figure skaters at the Winter Olympics have seen Adeliia Petrosian compete in real life.  Russia's exclusion from international sports events during its war with Ukraine means that the 18-year-old Petrosian has only skated one senior competition outside of her homeland, the qualifier that earned her place as a neutral athlete in Milan.  As she readies to skate to Michael Jackson's music in the short program Tuesday, no one besides Petrosian and her controversial coach, Eteri Tutberidze, can be sure of her form, or whether she's injury-free.
fullText:
MILAN (AP) ‚Äî Few figure skaters at the Winter Olympics have seen Adeliia Petrosian compete in real life.

She might leave with the gold medal.

Russia's exclusion from international sports events during its war with Ukraine means that the 18-year-old Petrosian has only skated one senior competition outside of her homeland, the qualifier that earned her place as a neutral athlete in Milan.

As she readies to skate to Michael Jackson's music in the short program Tuesday, no one besides Petrosian and her controversial coach, Eteri Tutberidze, can be sure of her form, or whether she's injury-free.

But if Petrosian can get past skaters like the U.S. ‚ÄúBlade Angels‚Äù trio of Amber Glenn, Alysa Liu and Isabeau Levito, and Japanese stars Kaori Sakamoto and Ami Nakai, she'll shoot to sudden fame as the fourth consecutive Olympic champion from Russia.

Petrosian is the latest star produced by Tutberidze, who revolutionized women's skating a decade ago by getting young girls barely in their teens to perform bigger and bigger jumps, only to have many of them struggle with repeated injuries.

She coached 2018 gold medalist Alina Zagitova, and a trio of standouts in 2022, when Anna Shcherbakova won the gold medal.

But the Beijing Games have been remembered less for Shcherbakova's triumph and more for the positive doping test turned in by another Tutberidze talent, 15-year-old Kamila Valieva. The case ended ultimately in a doping ban for Valieva that only recently ended, and an investigation into Tutberidze, though it found no evidence of wrongdoing by the Russian coach.

Tutberidze also was criticized for her harsh words toward her students in Beijing, while World Anti-Doping Agency president Witold Ba≈Ñka said last week that he didn't ‚Äúfeel comfortable with her presence‚Äù at the Milan Cortina Olympics.

As part of the fallout from the Valieva case, the International Skating Union increased the minimum age from 15 to 17 for senior-level athletes. That means Petrosian is one of the oldest women's skaters that Tutberidze has coached at a major championship.

Petrosian has landed quadruple jumps in Russian national events, much like her compatriots were able to do in previous Olympics, and none of the other skaters at the Milan Cortina Games are able to match those high-scoring elements.

The big question is whether she's fit enough to do it in Milan.

‚ÄúI can't turn properly,‚Äù Petrosian complained in a Russian documentary following Tutberidze released last week. Tutberidze said Petrosian had been making progress in a difficult program around the new year, but suddenly ‚Äúeverything hurt.‚Äù

There's been no indication of how Petrosian's condition may have changed in the last month as she readied for the Olympics.

Fitness has been a factor for months. Tutberidze previously told Russian media that Petrosian wanted to give up her place in September's Olympic qualifier for lower-ranked skaters after an injury but ended up competing because the Russian alternate's fitness was worse.

‚ÄúLet's imagine it's just Chelyabinsk.‚Äù That was the advice Russian skater Petr Gumennik got from his coach ahead of skating in the men‚Äôs event, to pretend that the Olympics were happening in that provincial Russian city.

For a few seconds, it felt as if the competition might indeed be happening in Russia.

‚ÄúWhen I went out there I got so much applause, there was such noise, you can't compare it to anything,‚Äù Gumennik said after skating in the short program, where he was 12th. ‚ÄúThat's Olympic support. It was unexpected and it gave me strength and confidence.‚Äù

Gumennik was greeted by fans waving personalized banners with his face, calling out ‚Äúwell done‚Äù in Russian.

There also was a Russian flag in the stands, even though Olympic organizers have barred it from the Games, where athletes such as Gumennik and Petrosian were vetted for any support of the war before they were allowed to compete as neutral athletes.

As the Russian with the best chance of a gold medal at these Olympics, there may be even more support when Petrosian skates. ___

AP Winter Olympics: https://apnews.com/hub/milan-cortina-2026-winter-olympics

title: King of the bumps: Kingsbury takes gold in the Olympic debut of men's dual moguls
description: Freestyle skiing great Mikael Kingsbury has upheld his reputation as the best in the bumps by winning the first Olympic gold in men‚Äôs dual moguls in the Italian Alps on Sunday.  The 33-year-old Canadian beat top rival Ikuma Horishima of Japan in the head-to-head final as the men's side of the sport made its Olympic debut at the Milan Cortina Games.  The gold was Kingsbury's fifth Olympic medal.
fullText:
LIVIGNO, Italy (AP) ‚Äî Freestyle skiing great Mikael Kingsbury has upheld his reputation as the best in the bumps by winning the first Olympic gold in men‚Äôs dual moguls in the Italian Alps on Sunday.

The 33-year-old Canadian beat top rival Ikuma Horishima of Japan in the head-to-head final as the men's side of the sport made its Olympic debut at the Milan Cortina Games.

The gold was Kingsbury's fifth Olympic medal.

This was the first Games to have dual moguls, with two skiers competing side-by-side as they carve through the bumpy course and complete two acrobatic jumps. They are judged for their skiing, the execution and difficulty of their jumps, and their times.

In moguls, which has been an Olympic event since 1992, skiers go down the course individually before their scores are ranked.

Kingsbury, who has amassed a record 100 World Cup wins, first won Olympic gold in moguls at the 2018 Pyeongchang Games.

He collected his third Olympic silver medal Thursday when he lost the moguls final in an upset to Australia‚Äôs Cooper Woods. He also finished second in the event in 2014 and 2022.

This was Canada‚Äôs first gold medal of these Games.

Horishima, 28, added the silver to his two bronze medals in moguls that he won earlier this week and in Beijing in 2022.

Australia‚Äôs Matt Graham edged Japan‚Äôs Takuya Shimakawa for the bronze in Livigno.

On Saturday, Australia's Jakara Anthony won gold in the debut of women's dual moguls.
